content: hey friends and fellow crafters this is a little bit of an unusual episode and
we're not going to be doing them micro scared little dungeon stuff we're doing
for a full-scale LARP so this is some armor I made for a LARP I one day it's
going to take a little bit for the intro because I want to give you the
background of what was going on so some very dear friends of mine wanted to run
a LARP for their son because he was really really interested and this isn't
like an official LARP this isn't something that that some society or
whatever they took this whole thing on themselves so I just have to hand it to
him for doing this for their son so they decided they wrote an adventure they
corralled all their friend all the friends they could Corral to be in this
thing and help and of course I joined and I was nominated to be the Dark Lord
so I want to make some cool props and one of them was I wanted I know this
all-powerful chaos Lord and I wanted to make this really cool armor for one it
looked cool and for two to protect me from the young kids with their fake
bopper sword you know I want to get another one gonna be beat up so I
thought well I'll make myself some armor well anyways I was really more than goal
I wasn't out there necessarily in the combats to do the fighting so it wasn't
such a big deal but there was one point where I had a couple points on my armor
that they had a tag and there was were the only points they could get me so I
have minions protecting me in this kind of thing but they were trying to jab in
there you know get the they quickly realized that they couldn't hurt me and
otherwise you know I wouldn't take any ones for any other hits just those
particular points so yeah so I made this armor to protect myself and I thought
it'd be fun to share with you guys so I wanted to show that you could do this
you could make this armor really cheaply if this stuff can be very expensive you
can make this really cheaply it's pretty darn sturdy I mean I made some armor for
some other people and they were taking pretty good hits on this with these
those Foam swords so and you know it didn't batch it up or anything so this
is some an option you could do for your own LARP or even Halloween or you know
if you just want to make some armor for the kids you know instead of going out
and spending all this money make your own cool armor what a great Halloween
thing or just to have an adventure in your own yard so let's go to the table
and I'll show you what I did to make my armor
I want to give a special shout out to Larry's Arkansas ders for supporting the
craft he's always been a friend and supporter of the craft and he is
supporting me at the friend level on my patreon and I want to thank you so much
Larry this is dedicated to you man say hey guys I want to show you the finished
armor before we got started this is the front plate of the armor there's two
there's a back and a front and there's straps going over the shoulders now the
straps are attached by just cardboard and there's a little uh little hooks
that go through paper and you can spread them out they're like little studs I use
those for the studs for the straps all the rest is just hot glued on there and
just some acrylic craft paint the only thing I have to keeping the two halves
together as some elastic between the between on the side between the two
halves now here it is in progress this is a front plate all this is is just
cardboard that I've cut to my torso shape and just added various piece
various shapes hot-glued various shapes to the cardboard to get an interesting
look now here with another one I have the shoulder straps off on but you can
see I have another Armour there that's a dwarven armor I'm making for my friend's
son he's gonna be a dwarf in the LARP so I thought those came out really cool so
stick around we'll go to the table I do have a video of me painting the armor so
let's hit the table I'll show you what that looks like
hey crafters here's my cardboard armor spray-painted flat black I also used I
painted on the outside and paint the inside the armor but I'd paint the
shoulder straps and I'm gonna use this blue gray to do some detail on the armor
so I'm gonna get a plate flat brush and we're a little bit out on the plate and
then I load my brush and start picking out the edges of the shapes on the armor
healers are really starting to pop out it's not just looking like a flat piece
of armor anymore really popping out that detail so let's go along pull out all
that detail I'm also adding some scuff marks that I used with a screwdriver eye
gouge into the armor to give some scuff marks and there we go looking nice
really brings the armor out as opposed to just a flat black cardboard painted
cardboard so we go just add some extra details it's extra highlights on the
ends there looking good okay now I'm going to use a white and I want to do
some glowing runes on this so I'm gonna start with white and I'll start painting
just runes I'm just making these up as I go along you could have a reference if
you wanted but I'm just I'm just thinking about as I go okay there we go
I got all the runes on there and a nice bright white there finish up last little
details nice now I'm going to use a kind of aqua blue and start filling in the
center of those runes so it looks like they're glowing on the outside and
filled in all those runes nobody's a light blue and I'm gonna do some
lightning crackling on the armor because my theme is kind of like I have
lightning powers so that I can use in the LARP so I'm gonna kind of do that
carry the theme on into the armor so just using a very thin brush just
pulling out squiggles trying to get the Lightning effect I imagine it you know
those Hollywood movies where lightning crackles over the surface yes what I'm
kind of imagining as I paint this on so looking good now I'm going to use a
gunmetal I'm gonna paint these metal tacks that I used to put the armor
together I also use hot glue of course but that's a nice little effect there
now I'm going to use a black acrylic craft paint and I'm going to paint some
of those gouges well all the gouges that I did with the screwdriver into the
armor there that's nice I'm going to add some detail on the back
I have this little buck I'm gonna paint the center that buckle
is actually a bamboo cocktail stick that I broke off and used for the center I've
got some brats on the back I'm eating some black and do some scuffs on the
back also some shadows and some detailing around the brats and I'm going
to use this elastic to hold the two pieces of armor together so I wanted
about a foot long and I'm gonna have I'm just kind of roughly measuring make sure
there's a foot and lengths enough to put on the armor so I'm going to hot glue
that down first and then I'm gonna start using the strips to give it extra
support so there's no way that this will rip off the no way this will come off so
to push that down and then just to add some extra strength I'm gonna go around
the edges of those strips so that should really secure that down now I'm gonna do
the other side so a little difficult because I've got the see I've got the
other side going there and I kind of hold it up and put the holder in place
hold that strap and the extra holder and I'll be good to
go for the LARP hey guys one last thing with the armor there is always something
you know you may have to change in your design when it you put it together I
figured out that my shell like armor it protruded out at a weird angle when I
put it on because it's so long but I fixed that by cutting out that little
center part there and it was able to bend down and you'll see that more when
I show you the full scale armor itself here we are with Franklin's tool our

me now you can see the video kind of freezing at certain points in us because

would freeze the video so that's the problem going on there but the

here's the final armor and I thought I came out really nice it really give me a

really give me a sense of power now a problem I did have with it was
originally constructed if I'll try to show you here it was kind of on my body
it was kind of like this because it was rigid in front but then when I put that
cut in the front it can bend so then it became you know it had contoured more

I put these little extra strips up reinforcement on the back or just
cardboard and you can see that just bends really easily and nicely and just
this these strips that I did in the construction just work to keep you know
you know the armor on me and yeah it just just worked out great
this was super cheap the kids had a blast had a really fun time and I find

running through the center that's all this is so I really didn't fight me that
I was more just just joining and doing specials and that kind of thing I was
pretty much invincible in the final battle they had to do these you know
other things they could beat on my minions but they had to do these other
things to actually kill me so finally they did and the other heroes won and
everything well you know ya hear us so yeah this is a cool little staff I had
when I played and that was the armor so I hope you enjoyed seeing that and you
